group_works.title: You are what you eat
group_works.creator_credit: Becky Bristow, William C. Crain and Barr Films

results.title: You are what you eat
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nutrition”.
Six lively programs hosted by Liza Goddard which offer information and practical advice on how to dramatically improve health by altering eating habits. Although aimed at British adults the programs are short and pacy and very relevant to Australian adolescents and adults. The contents are: “Food for life: how to include more fibre, fruit, vegetables and fish”, “Go with the grain: re-educating children to eat more grain”, “Don’t eat your heart out: reducing fats in the diet”, “Sweet nothing: try to eliminate sugar which provides no nourishment”, “Pinch of chemicals: manufactured goods contain additives, preservatives and salt”, “Food in the fast lane: simple suggestions for nourishing packed lunches and fast foods”.

group_siblings.title: You are what you eat

results.title: You are what you eat
results.creator_credit: Becky Bristow, William C. Crain and Barr Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nutrition”.
Animated sequences explore this theme, while two voices discuss the significance of each scene. They explain the importance of choosing food from all of the basic food groups to provide a balanced diet. They also explain how proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals are used in our bodies, how digestion changes the food we eat so our bodies can use the nutrients, and how exercise and rest are needed to help us grow strong and healthy.

results.title: New Versions of Comedy Classics
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Hot water; Safety last
group_works.creator_credit: Fred C Newmeyer, Bob Hoag and Time-Life Films

results.title: Never weaken; Why worry?
results.brief_description:
Episode of New versions of comedy classics series
In ‘Never Weaken’ Lloyd’s last short, (he subsequently made features), he hustles customers for his girlfriend who works for an osteopath. Cast also includes Mildred Davis, Roy Brooks, Charles A. Stevenson. In ‘Why Worry?’, Harold plays a rich hypochondriac visiting Latin America to cure his many ills. Oblivious of all around him, he becomes embroiled in a revolution without realising it. Cast also includes Jobyna Ralston, John Aasen, Leo White.

group_siblings.title: Hot water; Safety last
group_siblings.creator_credit: Fred C Newmeyer, Bob Hoag and Time-Life Films

results.title: Hot water; Safety last
results.creator_credit: Fred C Newmeyer, Bob Hoag and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Versions of Comedy Classics”
This film is a new print of two old comedy films. ‘Hot Water’, made in 1924, is about Harold taking a live turkey on a trolley ride and then taking his in-laws for an equally hysterical ride in his new car. Also stars Jobyna Ralston, Josephine Crowell, Charles A. Stevenson and Mickey McBan. Written by Tommy Gray and John Grey. The second film, called ‘Safety Last’, was made in 1923 and is about Harold going to the big city to make his fortune and includes the scene “Harold Lloyd on the clock”. Also stars Mildred Davis and Bill Strothers. Written by Jean C. Havez and Sam Taylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred C Newmeyer, Bob Hoag and Time-Life Films

results.title: The Freshman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Versions of Comedy Classics”.
This film is a new restored print of a 1925 comedy. “The Freshman” is about country boy Harold who goes to college and, after many tribulations, saves the day when he makes the winning touchdown at the big game.

results.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Horizons”.
Describes the aims and activities of the outward bound girls scheme, as it takes place in mid-west Wales, Shows girls in various recreational pursuits.

group_siblings.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions

results.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Horizons”.
The aims and activities of the ‘Outward Bound’ girls’ residential course at Rhewniar in the rugged country of mid-west Wales. Shows the arrival of a new course and the girls being introduced to the accommodation and facilities. Includes fitness training, tuition in camp craft, canoe construction, rope work, home nursing, drama and self expression. The girls are seen accepting the ever increasing challenge of mountains, rivers and open waters in progressive expeditions. Photographed by Alan Masters, edited by Stella Smallwood, music by Denis Moonan, commentary by Richard Baker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions
